io.jeo.geom

Class Bounds

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Envelope
      • io.jeo.geom.Bounds
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Bounds
extends Envelope
    Extension of Envelope providing additional utility.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static Bounds WORLD_BOUNDS_4326

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bounds

        public Bounds()
        Creates a new empty bounds.

      • Bounds

        public Bounds(Envelope env)
        Creates a new bounds from an existing envelope.

      • Bounds

        public Bounds(double west,
      double east,
      double south,
      double north)
        Creates a bounds from west, east, south, north values.
        Parameters:
        west - The westmost value on the horizontal axis, ie minX.
        east - The eastmost value on the horizontal axis, ie maxX.
        south - The southmost value on the vertical axis, ie minY.
        north - The northmost value on the vertical axis, ie maxY.

    • Method Detail

      • scale

        public static Bounds scale(Envelope env,
           double scale)
        Scales an envelope around its center coordinate.

        A scale < 1 will shrink the envelope, a scale > 1 will grow the envelope. The scale must be a positive value.

        Parameters:
        env - The envelope to scale.
        scale - The scale factor.
        Returns:
        The scaled enveloped.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If scale is not >= 0.

      • scale

        public static Bounds scale(Envelope env,
           double scale,
           Coordinate focus)
        Scales an envelope around a coordinate contained within the envelope.

        A scale < 1 will shrink the envelope, a scale > 1 will grow the envelope. The scale must be a positive value.

        Parameters:
        env - The envelope to scale.
        scale - The scale factor.
        focus - The coordinate within the envelope to scale around.
        Returns:
        The scaled enveloped.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If focus is not contained with env.
        IllegalArgumentException - If scale is not >= 0.

      • expand

        public static Bounds expand(Envelope env,
            double x,
            double y)
        Expands an envelope.
        Parameters:
        env - The envelope to expand.
        x - The x amount to expand by.
        y - The y amount to expand by.
        Returns:
        The expanded envelope.

      • square

        public static Bounds square(Envelope env)
        Adjusts the envelope to have a square aspect ratio, expanding vertically/horizontally as required.
        Parameters:
        env - The envelope to expand.
        Returns:
        The square envelope.

      • corners

        public static List<Coordinate> corners(Envelope env)
        Returns a list of the 4 corners of the envelope, starting with the lower left corner and continuing clockwise to the lower right.
        Parameters:
        env - the envelope.
        Returns:
        List of 4 corners.

      • tile

        public static <T extends Envelope> Iterable<T> tile(T env,
                                    double resx,
                                    double resy,
                                    T reuse)
        Partitions the envelope into smaller envelopes.

        The order of tiles returns starts from the lower left corner and proceeds in column-major order.

        The reuse parameter can be used to prevent a new envelope being created at each iteration. This should only be used when envelopes from the iterator will not be modified.

        Parameters:
        env - The envelope to tile.
        resx - The horizontal resolution to tile at, in the range of (0,1].
        resy - The vertical resolution to tile at, in the range of (0,1].
        reuse - Optional envelope instance to reuse during calculation.
        Returns:
        Iterable of new envelopes.

      • translate

        public static Bounds translate(Envelope env,
               double dx,
               double dy)
        Translates an envelope along the x/y axis.
        Parameters:
        env - The envelope to translate.
        dx - The horizontal / x-axis displacement.
        dy - The vertical / y-axis displacement.
        Returns:
        The translated envelope.

      • toPolygon

        public static Polygon toPolygon(Envelope e)
        Converts the envelope to a Polygon.

      • isNull

        public static boolean isNull(Envelope e)
        Checks if the envelope is null.

        This method returns true if the reference is null or Envelope.isNull() returns true.

      • toString

        public static String toString(Envelope e)
        Encodes an envelope as a string of the form <x1>,<y1>,<x2,<y2>.

      • toString

        public static String toString(Envelope e,
              String delim,
              boolean alt)
        Encodes an envelope as a string with the specified delimiter and flag controlling order.

        When alt is true the order is <x1>,<y1>,<x2,<y2>, when false the order is <x1>,<x2>,<y1,<y2>

      • parse

        public static Bounds parse(String str)
        Parses a string of the form <x1>,<y1>,<x2,<y2> into an envelope.

        To parse an envelope of the form <x1>,<x2>,<y1,<y2> call parse(str, false)

      • parse

        public static Bounds parse(String str,
           boolean alt)
        Parses a string into an envelope.
        Parameters:
        str - The envelope string.
        alt - Whether x/y components alternate, if true the str argument must be of the form <x1>,<y1>,<x2,<y2>. If false the str argument must be of the form tt><x1>,<x2>,<y1,<y2>.

      • parse

        public static Bounds parse(String str,
           boolean alt,
           String delim)
        Parses a string into an envelope.
        Parameters:
        str - The envelope string.
        alt - Whether x/y components alternate, if true the str argument must be of the form <x1>,<y1>,<x2,<y2>. If false the str argument must be of the form tt><x1>,<x2>,<y1,<y2>.
        delim - Delimiter for x/y components.

      • flip

        public static Envelope flip(Envelope e)
        Flips the x/y axis of the envelope.
        Returns:
        The new envelope.

      • random

        public static Envelope random(Envelope bbox,
              float res)
        Generates a random envelope at the specified resolution and constrained by the specified bounds.
        Parameters:
        bbox - Envelope containing the randomly generated envelope.
        res - Resolution of containing envelope to generate random envelope at, in the exclusive range (0,1).
        Returns:
        The randomly generated envelope.

      • randoms

        public static List<Envelope> randoms(Envelope bbox,
                     float minRes,
                     float maxRes,
                     int n)
        Generates a set of random bounding box constrained by area and resolution.
        Parameters:
        bbox - Envelope containing the randomly generated envelope.
        minRes - Minimum resolution constraint.
        maxRes - Maximum resolution constraint.
        n - Number of bounding boxes to generate.
        See Also:
        random(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Envelope, float)

      • west

        public double west()
        Returns the left/west ordinate of the bounds.

        Synonym for Envelope.getMinX().

      • south

        public double south()
        Returns the bottom/south ordinate of the bounds.

        Synonym for Envelope.getMinY().

      • east

        public double east()
        Returns the right/east ordinate of the bounds.

        Synonym for Envelope.getMaxX().

      • north

        public double north()
        Returns the top/north ordinate of the bounds.

        Synonym for Envelope.getMaxY().

      • tile

        public Iterable<Bounds> tile(double resx,
                    double resy)
        Partitions the bounds into smaller components.

        Example of tiling a bounds into 4 smaller bounds: 

        
  Bounds b = new Bounds(0,10,0,10);
  b.tile(0.5, 0.5);

        Parameters:
        resx - The horizontal resolution to tile at, in the range of (0,1].
        resy - The vertical resolution to tile at, in the range of (0,1].
        Returns:
